text: Roaring along through the tunnel. Headed for Coney Island. The Warriors sit side by sida. The Pox slumps down in a seat. Weary. . . Pace battered.
I don't know, it’ Ss got to stop. This ain't the way people live.-
Don't kid yourself. Where were we headed anyway. /- Tonight just speeded things -
No...there’s got to be some. choice. Something besides getting our ass chased off and getting wasted.
Looks over at Rembrandt. Rev. 6/16/78 106.
This shit don't happen every night.

Yeah, right. . Not many conclave's come :along... The big Cyrus...going to yun the city. Some crap that was...those cats uptown aren't going to let anyone, much less us, take it away from . them...no way... * They'd drop the A-bomb on us first.
Naw. Cyrus was right. It's all there. All we got to do is go steal it.
Yeah. We just got to carry on. We ain't big but we’ re somebody.
Oh yeah. Tell me what we count for.
We do our part. They need us down on the bottom so that there's a top. We get even by ripping them off every time we get 2a chance. .
That ain't much of a choice.
I*il teil you something. Don't let go of your spray can. It's your passport in case you want to get out. Rembrandt smiles.
Ah, I'm just pretty good.
. Naw. You're great ...You can make a living at it. ;  Rav. 6/16/78 107-108. contd. 311 311
What's your passport.
I‘m working on it. The train begins to slow...

Assorted late-night passengers. Then two young couples returning from a prom step on board. A iot of laughing and chatting... They move down the car and find four open seats. The doors close, the train starts again. 313 ‘TRAIN “313 The Fox's eyes gradually focus on the two couples across from him.
The boys. wearing white dinner jackets. The girls in long summer formals.
Looking at them. Mercy senses The Pox stare... Opens her eyes and sees the couple.
Whispering, chuckling among themselvas. One of the boys happens to glance at The Fox and Mercy... .  315 316

3248 Rev. 6/16/73 lio. CONTD. Snowball, Rembrandt, Cowhoy, Mercy and The Fox. Then, just before the doors close... The Fox turns, stoops and grabs the fallen corsage. Mercy looks at him, he shrugs... Hands her the flowers.
What’s this for.
Some people |like flowers. I hate seeing anything go to waste, | you know... She takes the flowers. ‘MERCY What's your real name. He's got his head down. Can*t quite look her in the eye.
Francis. Francis Conroy. They call me’ The Fox because of Francis... you know...and becanse I'm smart. Pause.
Prancis Conroy. I like that nane.
Yeah. We better ga.
Approach the steps at the side of the platform. Just as they are about to Start down, they pause, look out. —-. All of them too tired to show any emotion.
We made it.
Yeah, lcoks raal great...
The tenements, the beach, the litter. THE Fox 3248 Still leoking,
324B conrD. THE FOX 3245 325 Home Sweet Home. Pause. .
Cowboy was right. It’s all there. Ali anybody's got to do is go steal it. — Pause.
The hard part is trying to figure if it’s even worth Stealing...
I don't think you're going to hang around here much lenger.
How come you say that. . MERCY . I don't know. Just a feeling.
Yeah. Maybe you're right... Maybe I'll just take off. He starts down the steps.
Wait for me...You know I like traveling too.
You like traveling. Where'd you ever go.
I've never been anywhere. I just know I'd like it. She follows him down the stairwell.
A view from across the street as they wearily clump down the stairs. - :  326 327 Rev. 7/16/73 LLiA
Driven by Rogues. Luther is next to Cropsey, behind the wheel. As the Warriors reach the street, he taps Cropsey’s am, Cropsey turns the key, starts the motor...
Moving groggily along the widewaAlk. Just beyond them the hearse pulls away from the curb. Starts ta creep alongside them.  112. 327A THE Fox , 327A
329 330 331 Walking with the rest. Dog-tired. — : His head down, seeing nothing. Then gradually, the sound of the Cadillac's engine begins to penetrate. He lifts his head, glances over ...

Luther sitting beside Cropsey. THE Fox , 329 No change of expression. . , He simply drops his eyes again, leoks straight ahead. A clam bar diner is fifty or sixty feat up the block. Mercy is walking tiredly on one side of him. Rembrandt on the other.
Duck behind the clam bar. They walk a few steps further. .- .
What are you talking about A few more steps.
Duck behind the clam bar. Another pause.
What the hell for.
Just do it. bo it. He suddenly cuts into an alley beside the clam bar. Drags Mercy after him. The other Warriors following.
The Cadillac stops sharply ... /
Pulling up winded in the service alley.  331  CONTD. rev.6/19/73 ° 113. 331 .It runs along behind the hot deg stands. A long pause. They look at one
. We got one more bop to go..-
What the shit is this. Who are those guys. CoMBoY Let's bag this one. I had enough for tonight ... We don’t even know these dudes ...
I doz
That’s them.
Yeah. The Rogues.... the ones what wasted Cyrus. Now they're here to waste us.
I got an idea- Let's run.
Yeah. Right.
Yeah. Sounds great... where we going te run to... another.
Let’s get even. it's the £irst time he’s ever Spokan. Tension building
Hey, nobody ever thought you had a tongue.
Let's get even for Cyrus... For Cleon, for Varmin, for Cochise, for Ajax... for Swan.
id.
We got to.
Yeah... Puck the fucking Rogues. . E'm ready to bop. Now all of them ready to fight.
The hearse is still there. Waiting.
Draws Mercy to the end. of the building.
Look, you wait a couple of seconds after we move, then cut the other way up the alley, take your first right and follow it to the beach. There's. some steps down under the Boardwalk, you wait there.
Why can’t I stay with you.
Just do what I tell you. Okay ... She's almost afraid to meet his eye. ‘MERCY Listen I never had anything like this, I don't want to lose...
Just do what I tell you. The Warriors hegin moving down the alley. Peer between the buildings toward the street. omIT 334
The Cadillac is moving again, keeping pace with them.  334 3364 337 334

Passes a pile of junk furnitvre. Suddenly reaches to the right... Snaps off the leg of a chair.
The hearse still moving along. The Rogues watching every break hetween the buildings.
Cowboy breaks the radio aerial from @ car. Snaps it like a buggy-whip ... . The Fox grabs a loose pipe, jerks it off a brick wall. . Snowball hefts his hall-bat...
You guys must be looking for trouble. They all leok down the alley.
Just standing there. Very caln.
Jesus, are they glad to see him... Now all smiles. ,
The Cadillac ... That's the- bunch that got Cyrns.
Yeah. And nailed us with the blame... : . ‘ COWBOY - . They're the reason we’re the only Ones left. Pause. SWAN . Maybe we better give them a chance at what they want.
Fucking A. .
Everybody packed.

348 Still looking at the sea ... : . . 348 Then he turns, faces Luther for the first time.

Why did you do it. Why did you sheot him. Luther grins. Pause. LUTHER . No reason, I just like doing things like that ... I€ that prick over there hadn't seen me you guys would be okay ... But I guess you already thought of that haven't you.
Let's do it. Me and you. Luther continues shiling. . Now has his hand in his pocket. — . . . LUTHER . One on one, Kiss my ass. You're fucking dead. Ail of you ... and you know it.
I don't think so. Luther raises his hand. Slowly. Magnum .357.
You don't hear too good, You're dead, cocksucker. Swan smjies. The big gun starts to come up. GO level. Swan pivots. . . . Gun blast and FLICK, CHUNK ..,

Ocobhhmygoddd:!1 "Swan's bowie knife has gone entirely through his forearn. The .357 falis harmlessly at his feet. Swan stéps forward. Jerks the knife out of Luther's arm. Wipes the blood on his Pant leg. The Rogues and Warriors stunned by the sudden violence.  348
. Luther falis to his knees in the sand. - Clutches his arm. Begins to cry. SWAN : 3483. Just standing there. Looking at the rest of the Rogues.

Glance at one another. And the crying Luther: They start forward ... a reluctant army but willing to Eight ... THE FOX 348c Wide smile across his whole face ... : TEE FOX . I think you guys got bigger - problems than hopping with . us ... His eyes glance beyond the Rogues. —
A ring of silent faces. The Gramercy Riffs, One hundred of them. The New Cyrus standing at the fore.
All of them smiling except Swan.
‘The Riffs now totally circle the warriors and Rogues. Luther still on his knees. Still crying.
Looks down at Luther. Then at Swan.
You gave us a bad night.  351 352 rev.6/19/78 120. .
Bad night my ass. it was shit.
You Warriors are good ... real good. He looks at Luther.
The rest is ours.
Take it. Turns, looks at the Warriors. Mercy is walking toward them across the sand. The Fox sees her ... : A moment hetween them.
Let's go home. They start across the beach...
Watching them go. Then turn, ‘The Rogues are no longer visible inside the circle...
Rembrandt walking close te Swan. Sears start coming to his face.
We made it. We made it. Tf don't believe it. We made it.
Why not. We're the Warriors. A quiet tone in Rembrandt's voice.
Yeah... We're the Warriors. They're at the ocean's edge. Cowboy and Rembrandt walk to the water. Stand there ankle deep...
Standing alone...
Off by themselves... The Fox locks at Swan... Nods... Takes Mercy and moves off up the beach...
Watching them go... He turns again, looks back at the sea... FADE. Rev. 6/16/78
